intro: Erythranthe scouleri, commonly known as Scouler's monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Phrymaceae family and is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as streambanks and meadows. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Erythranthe scouleri is often found in association with other wildflowers in its native environment.
